answers.answer: Hi!I think that your doctor may be looking for a polyp, when she is recommending the saline infusion scan.  Typically in a case like this it all boils down to the fact that your hormones are out of balance.  Too much estrogen not enough progesterone.  This is common enough to be almost normal in perimenopausal women.  Depending upon your risk factors for endometrial cancer ( obesity, diabetes, family history, etc)  I might be tempted to treat you with progesterone for 14 days and then re-scan.If you are at high risk for endometrial cancer, or have a polyp on saline scan, I would probably recommend a D&C hysteroscopy.Hope this helps!Dr B
